features: This full motion TV wall mount is an ideal solution for most 23"-55" flat panel TVs up to 66lbs. Adjustable swivel arm and tilting VESA plate provides maximum viewing flexibility. Cable clips included keep cables organized. Key hole VESA plate allows TVs to be easily installed.

Trying to install your TV Mount ahead of the big Sunday football game? With easy 30 minute install on a single wood stud, we've got you covered with all hardware included and pre-divided. Easy to follow instructions and live install assistance is available every day of the week.

Window glare bugging you? Articulation controls allow for+15°~ -15°Tilt; +90°~ -90° Swivel, adjusting for your perfect viewing angle. No tools, no fuss, no hands. Just kidding, you'll need your hands.

This TV mount has low profile single articulating arm set. VESA compliant: 75x75, 100x100, 200x100, 200x200, 300 x 300,400 x 400. Please check VESA (mounting hole pattern) to making purchase decision to determine whether this TV wall mount fits your TV and the installation application.
body.description: An ideal way to mount your Monitor or LCD panel TV to the wall,to use your space efficiently and watch your favorite TV shows comfortably! This TV Wall Mount is designed to fit most 23"-55" flat-panel plasma, LCD, and LED-backlit LCD TVs. the Load Weight capacity up to 66 lbs, ensure secure support and long lasting durability. This unit is designed to use the standard VESA patterns installed in almost all flat screen TVs VESA compatible with 75x75, 100x100, 200x100, 200x200, 300 x 300,400 x 400.Please check VESA (mounting hole pattern) to making purchase decision to determine whether this TV wall mount fits your TV and the installation application. Articulation controls allow for+15°~ -15°tilt; +90°~ -90° swivel, adjusting for your perfect viewing angle. 100.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: • Universal Design-Our sturdy TV wall mount is compatible with most 23”-55” TVs you can find on the market including Samsung, Vizio, Sony, Panasonic, LG, Sharp, Toshiba, etc. The strong construction is able to carry a TV flat panel/LED/LCD/OLED Monitor/Curved TV weighing up to 77lbs. From min 75x75 to max 400x400 VESA patterns, the TV mount can support them all. • Full Motion Adjustability-The strong full motion articulating arm enables a large extension distance from 3.5” to 15.7” which is perfect for customized viewing distance for a one-stud for a ,comfortable TV viewing experience. The ±90° ample swivel range allows you to watch TV from different locations, unlocking more possibilities of TV viewing. • Corner TV Wall Mount-The space-saving one stud design is perfect for corner installation, freeing up more spacean work or bookshelves, wardrobes, cabinets and more. • Anti-Glare Tilting Mechanism-Coming with -20°~+ 20° tilting design, the TV bracket not only allows you to have optimized TV viewing experience by reducing the glare on your screen, but also provides comfortable viewing angles. • Quality Hinge Pin & Gasket-The high strength hinge pin is able to hold up to 66lbs with stability. As the hinge pin and gasket smoothly working together, the TV wall mount allows for precise positioning and effortless swinging from side to side. • Easy Installation-The TV mount is compatible with wood studs/concrete wall/brick wall installation. With all required mounting hardware prepared, only 3 steps are needed to mount your TV on wall. The intuitive installation manual and video enable easy TV mounting without hassle. • Convenient & Safe- The open plate design allows you to directly mount the bracket over electrical outlets, solving any problems of wire organization. The extra security screws are added to prevent the TV mount from accidental removal and sliding off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than most on installing
reviews.reviewText: It came with a bubble level, and lots of screws for different methods of hang a tv. I used a small drill bit and drilled until I found both edges of the stud. I knew where the stud was, but not the middle. Then I drilled a hole all the way into the stud, where the lag bolts went. The reason I needed to find the middle of the stud, is because the lag Bolts are so large, I didn't want to take a chance of just splitting the stud behind the wall. The older the house, the more likely it will split, but it can happen in new homes too. If you split the stud, It wont hold much weight. The pilot drill holes were important too, so this wouldn't happen. It took me about a hour, getting it right. It took me a while to decide how high, I wanted the Tv. I measured the tv while it was in the box. I didn't realize the mount was not in the middle and assumed it was. So, I had to take it back down and lower the bracket. I move the top hole on the bracket to the middle hole. I will have to chalk the top hole. Be careful not to over tighten the bolt and strip out the hole. It wont hold anything if you strip it. The plate mounted directly onto the Tv, without those extra arms, that stick out in the picture. That was nice. I installed a 55 in Hisense Roku Tv. Because the arm swings, it is easy to find a stud close enough to mount it to and just swing it to the side or middle, whatever makes it line up where you want it. The pro's say 61 in. to the bottom of the Tv is just right. I wanted mine at the level I could recline, all the way back and watch Tv, without my chin on my chest. So the bottom of my Tv ended up about 66 inches off the floor. That angle is not to bad, for the folks sitting on the sofa either. You need need to take the time and tape some cardboard up or something and see what works for you, because this is not something you want to start all over again. Over the fireplace is not recommended for several reasons. If you use the fireplace, it is to hot and Smokey for the electronics and It is rarely a comfortable viewing position. But, If you like me and that is where you really want it, who cares, do it anyway. I liked the product and the price. It does the job. It is as easy as any to install. Just be careful, handling that large TV, these new TV's are more fragile than an egg. I broke two so far, at different times (in the past). It is expensive to be careless or in a bad mood while installing.
